section.title: Correlating messages
section.para: All messages/responses received via a Receiver are passed to a Correlator which notifies the correct SenderTask. The Correlator component can extract a correlation ID from both the requesnt and the response. It can also have an active role and actually create a correlation ID and store it in the request message.
Correlator is always bound to a Receiver and does not make any sense without it.

example.title: An example of a correlator configuration
example.programlisting: <receiver class="..." threads="..."> <correlator class="..."> ... correlator properties ... </correlator> <source>...</source> ... receiver properties ... </receiver>
example.para: When specifying the correlator class, unless you enter a fully classified class name, the default package org.perfcake.message.correlator is assumed.
In the following sections you can find a complete description of all correlators that can be used by PerfCake including all of their properties.
